results.definition: any abnormal position of the organs of the body
an event in which one thing is substituted for another
the act of reversing the order or place of
(electricity) a rearrangement of the relative positions of power lines in order to minimize the effects of mutual capacitance and inductance
examples: he wrote a textbook on the electrical effects of transposition

results.definition: (genetics) a kind of mutation in which a chromosomal segment is transfered to a new position on the same or another chromosome
(mathematics) the transfer of a quantity from one side of an equation to the other along with a change of sign
(music) playing in a different key from the key intended; moving the pitch of a piece of music upwards or downwards
